sources.title: The Amazing Dr. Clitterhouse (1938)
sources.description: The Amazing Dr. Clitterhouse is a crime-comedy film that revolves around Dr. Phillip Clitterhouse, a wealthy and respected physician played by Edward G. Robinson. Fascinated by the criminal mind, Clitterhouse becomes increasingly intrigued by the world of crime and decides to conduct a unique experiment.Clitterhouse wants to understand criminals from a scientific perspective, so he decides to immerse himself in their world, posing as a criminal to conduct his studies. He meets a group of gangsters, including a smooth-talking criminal named "Rico" and a tough female character named "Joan." Clitterhouse gains their trust and starts participating in their illegal activities.As Clitterhouse delves deeper into the criminal underworld, he begins to struggle with moral dilemmas and the consequences of his actions, questioning the ethics of his experiment. The plot intensifies as Clitterhouse's true identity is at risk of being uncovered, leading to a series of comedic mishaps and tense encounters with law enforcement.Ultimately, Clitterhouse must confront the fallout from his experiments, leading to a resolution that blends both humor and a commentary on crime and morality.

metadata.Plot: Dr. Clitterhouse is fascinated with the working of the criminal mind. His interest is so deep that he finds the best way to observe criminals in action is to become one himself. Whilst robbing a safe at an exclusive party he stumbles across an organized gang trying to do the same thing. He teams up with the gang to observe them in action but one of the members, Rocks Valentine would like nothing better than to see Clitterhouse out of the way.
